alert.note: Alert for Cedar (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:46PM CDT until March 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON...NORTHEASTERN CEDAR...SOUTHEASTERN JONES AND NORTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 546 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Eden Valley Refuge, or 10 miles west of Maquoketa, moving northeast at 55 mph. Other possible tornadoes were located northeast of Wyoming, and also near Lost Nation. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Nashville and Maquoketa Municipal Airport around 550 PM CDT. Maquoketa, Hurstville, Maquoketa Caves State Park, Ironhills, Buckhorn and Emeline around 555 PM CDT. Fulton, Crab Town and South Gary Owen around 600 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Andrew, Otter Creek and Cottonville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This storm has a history of producing tornadoes. Seek shelter now! Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
